sense.name: submerge, cover, or fill (as if) with a liquid
sense.commentary: Includes: SOAK UP, SOAK THROUGH Syntax is: NP1[concrete] SOAK NP2[concrete] NOTE: Includes metaphorical uses, except the ones for SOAK UP.
sense.examples: Soak the bandage in antiseptic for 5 minutes. The water has totally soaked through my clothes. This industrial sponge soaks up twice the liquid as a regular one. Rita loved to soak in the tub for hours. The pipe exploded and soaked the carpet. Soak your hands in the lotion mixture and they'll come out smooth. My anger soaked me, turning me into a beast.

sense.name: ask an unreasonable price or leave a guarantee in return for money
sense.examples: That used car dealer was sure soaking us!

sense.name: beat or punish severly
sense.examples: Mama soaked me for letting the cat get out.

sense.name: make or become drunk
sense.examples: We soaked Julie at the party last night.

sense.name: heat metal prior to working it
sense.examples: You need a full firing for 30 minutes to soak the metal with heat.

sense.name: SOAK UP: take in information readily; devote oneself to a task
sense.commentary: Is: SOAK UP Syntax is: NP1[animate] SOAK UP NP2[abstract] NOTE: INcludes metaphorical instances of sense 1.
sense.examples: Little children just soak up languages. The architect soaked up our ideas, and produced a perfect plan for our new house. We soaked up the sights of Philly like a sponge.
